alert.note: Alert for De Witt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 4:33PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and east central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan and McLean. In east central Illinois, Piatt. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since early this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 0.75 inch is possible east of Bloomington through 530 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Clinton, Le Roy, Heyworth, Farmer City, Atlanta, Colfax, Downs, McLean, Saybrook, Wapella, Waynesville, Cooksville, Beason, Bellflower, Arrowsmith, Cropsey, Ellsworth, Lawndale and Anchor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
